  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMER [CUSTOMER] PARTICIPATED IN AN OPTIONSHOUSE MARKETING PROMOTION IN WHICH CUSTOMERS BECAME ELIGIBLE FOR A FREE DELL MONITOR BY OPENING AND FUNDING A NEW ACCOUNT WITH CERTAIN MINIMUM FUNDING REQUIREMENTS.  [CUSTOMER] FUNDED A NEW ACCOUNT MAY 17, 2011 WITH THE MINIMUM REQUIRED FUNDING LEVEL ($100K) IN ORDER TO QUALIFY FOR A 27\" DELL MONITOR.  [CUSTOMER] WAS SHIPPED HIS DELL MONITOR ON OR AROUND JUNE 15, 2011.  HOWEVER, [CUSTOMER] FAILED TO ABIDE BY ALL TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PROMOTION BY TRANSFERRING HIS FUNDS TO ANOTHER BROKERAGE ON JULY 19, 2011 THEREBY FAILING TO SATISFY THE MINIMUM 180-DAY HOLDING PERIOD.  AS A RESULT OF [CUSTOMER'S] FAILURRE TO COMPLY WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PROMOTION, OPTIONSHOUSE DEBITED [CUSTOMER'S] ACCOUNT FOR THE MARKET VALUE OF THE DELL MONITOR ($1,099)PREVIOUSLY SHIPPED TO HIM.  ON AUGUST 3, 2011 OPTIONSHOUSE RECLAIMED $1,099 FROM THE PREVIOULSY-PROCESSED ACCOUNT TRANSFER TO COVER THE DEBIT IN [CUSTOMER'S] ACCOUNT AT OPTIONSHOUSE.  [CUSTOMER] PROCEEDED TO RETURN $100K TO HIS OPTIONSHOUSE ACCOUNT ON AUGUST 31, 2011 ONLY TO AGAIN TRANSFER THE FUNDS OUT ON OCTOBER 13, 2011.  COMBINED, [CUSTOMER] HELD THE MINIMUM REQUIRED FUNDING OF $100K IN HIS OPTIONSHOUSE ACCOUNT FOR FEWER THAN 100 DAYS, FAR SHORT OF THE REQUIRED 180 DAYS.  OPTIONSHOUSE CONTINUES TO HOLD $1,099 THAT WAS PREVIOUSLY DEBITED FROM [CUSTOMER'S] ACCOUNT DUE TO HIS REFUSAL TO COMPLY WITH THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE PROMOTION.  OPTIONSHOUSE IS HOPEFUL OF REACHING AN AMICABLE SETTLEMENT OF THIS MATTER WITH [CUSTOMER] AND IS CONFIDENT THIS MATTER WILL NOT PROCEED TO AN ARBITRATION HEARING.",
